page.title: 08The coastguard
page.content: The coastguards are a Government department. There are 560 full time coastguards and many auxillary coastguards who are paid for the hours of duty they work. The English coastguards are part of a united maritime organisation which looks after coasts all around the world. In our area there are 15 auxillary coastguards and one full time officer. The coastguard keeps in touch with ships through British Telecom phones. our local coastguard looks after an area from Preston Docks to Arnside. There is a coastguard station at Rossall Point. The coastguard has a VHF radio that enables him to speak to any one of the 24 coastguard sites around the British Isles.
